intro: Lappula capensis, commonly known as the African bladder campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Lappula capensis is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
